content.label:
Took me a while to figure out, but once I did I couldn't put it down. 

MUST. HAVE. MORE!

Rebuild is an ideal simplified 4x game.  Fast paced, easy to control and with plenty to do and see.  The game is pretty easy on lower difficulty settings, but can become quite challenging the higher the difficulty.  There are also multiple endings to entice multiple playthroughs.  Though it lacks character development, it can become quite easy to become attached to some of your more developed characters, only to have a freak accident occur and them wind up dead.  I played through the campaign quickly and am in the process of playing at higher difficulties and attempting for the best ending.

Overall an excellent little game that is well worth the time and money.
Great game so many things to do so many ways to do it so many paths to take and items to obtain. i highly reccomend this game
I've enjoyed this game. I also liked the no in-app purchases.
It is a good game but crashes too much and I have iOS 9

Pick up and start playin this game. When you put it down, HOURS have passed. 

This game has made me tardy for many a party.

The only app that gets better than this is the next one they make. Rightfully earns my 5 stars!
---(More below)---

Try it for yourself, and you'll enjoy the graphics, story, simple management, and multiple choices!
One of the best phone games on the store. Definitely worth the cash.

Was really excited for this game having really enjoyed rebuild and rebuild 2 on pc and mobile but was disappointed. There are some improvements I like random events, interaction with other clans, more gameplay. But some things I can't stand, Too much focus on character customization and stats while previous games focused on strategy and city build I feel this game was too much based on the citizens and the gui of the citizens on each building doesn't sit right with me it just seems too different of a game and didn't retain the unique building and zombie type game the previous games had.

The one-more-turn syndrome hasn't hit me this hard since the early days of Civilization. More than once I've stayed up an hour or two longer than I meant to because this game was so engrossing. That's both an endorsement and a warning.
I want my money back.

After a while it gets more and more difficult which makes it fun. My only complaint is it could use more content but there hasn't been a big update in forever. But there are plenty of small updates fixing the little things.

What a waste of money. Impossible to expand the town. Game play only lasts 15 min. or so then you are overwhelmed. Zombies spawn every 10 seconds, and can move as much as 14 squares in like 10 seconds. You take a building and lose 2-4 at the same time. Survivors rarely spawn. I give this game 12 thumbs down
Don't listen to the guy whining about the price this is easily worth 5 bucks and then some. Fantastic game and a joy to play.

This game is okay, extremely repetitive from city to city (Campaign Mode). Very little change in terms of strategy, difficulty, or story. You even encounter the same factions on a rotating basis. The developers should've priced it at $0.99 because that's all it's worth.

This is a great zombie civ game. 

There are no in app purchases. 

May you survive and prosper in the coming zombie apocalypse. 

^.^
Can't stop playing

Love this game! Insanely high replay value

***Update: please make the monkey blood quest less difficult. It is absurd to have to go through all that just so you don't get an ending that results in your death

title.label: My all-time favorite game -- I mean it!

content.label: Rebuild 3 has to be my all-time favorite game. Sarah Northway is s tremendous talent! I love the shear game play as well as the writing and art. I'm jonesing for my next dose of bath salts in the form of your next game, Sarah!
I really love the game and the story line that goes with it, but there needs to be a way to counteract the spread of cultism within your faction.
Good game but way to many zombie attacks
I played this game for 300 hours on the PC! On the app version I play it just about every single day almost. It's definitely worth the money! 😃

Rebuild 3 is a fun, strategic, zombie game in which the player assigns people on missions to ultimately reclaim a city from the zombie virus.
With quick play and a full length console-length campaign that lasts hours upon hours, this game is hard to put down.
It improves in every way from it's previous game, making things less confusing and less tedious. 

Some things you should know before buying this game is that
1. This game is DARK. If you can't handle hard moral choices then maybe this game is not for you.
2. This game is hard. This game can be brutal and unforgiving. Playing it on normal mode can be a real challenge. Now, that's not a bad thing. I personally like it! But I know some people might not so fair warning.
3. This game can be complex. If you're looking for a simple one touch game, you will not find that here.

If you think you can deal with all that, I sincerely recommend it!
10/10
To put it in simply terms, civ with zombies. It has research, expansion, battles and diplomacy. It really has that one more turn mentally and you can play turn based or rts. Well worth 4 bucks

name.label: I HATE IT I HATE IT

content.label: I hope your working on anther other one but this is a really good game I played the first one and loved it (:👍🏻<3

title.label: Great game for strategy and zombies

content.label:
Pros:
- can control many characters that you can level up and customize
- engaging storyline keeps you wanting to find out what happens next
- factions to compete with add challenge and complexity
Cons:
- gameplay can get repetetive
- apparently to get the good ending you have to discover certain things within different levels but this was not clear
Summary: This game is great if you like strategy, conquest, leveling up characters, and zombies. I wouldnt play over again but would definitely play a sequel.
Wow! This game is amazing, just finished the story and it was better and more fun than most AAA titles, and I highly recommend playing this game.

This game literally has every aspect of a zombie apocalypse incorporated in it. Scavenging for supplies for multiple different things, killing zombies and humans etc. its a great strategy game when played on harder difficulties and a smooth fun one when played on lower difficulties. Overall this game is amazing and at an amazing price. 

If this game were to evolve even more I probably wouldn't be able to contain myself.
Great strategy game with addictive story that had me hooked for weeks

I just bought this game, it always gets stuck at 60%. I don't know what's wrong with it, I tried deleting it and redown
 loading.

title.label: Best game on the App Store

content.label: If you liked any of the previous rebuild games this is the app for you, I spend hours playing it.
A really compelling story (although my ending was not as I'd hoped), good gameplay, and no IAP or ad nonsense. Well done.

Suggestion:
As far as I'm concerned, you can't highlight a character when you select their names. 

It's hard to find people sometimes so I think if you select their name, they would be able to locate where they are.
Like everyone else has said: this is a great game. Worth more than it costs. I played it for hours straight and look forward to playing it more.

title.label: Hate is game is there a return app for it

content.label: I hate this game and it should be a return ability for in-app store

Great game, but the Game Center integration for achievements doesn't work.  I've tried everything to make them work, nothing.  Great replay ability by itself, but I can't help but feel like I'm not getting part of what I paid for.

I can't agree with the other reviews more.  Normally I'm bored looking thru the App Store trying to find games that don't just put a face lift on an old game and constantly barrage you with IAP's.  This is an original game play style game, no IAP's and super entertaining.  I normally play games until i get sick of them and I will probably do that to this one, but haven't gotten sick of it yet and I keep wanting to play more and more.  I love survival horror and this is right there, with resource management, different character classes, zombies.  I love it all!  Well done!  Please keep the content coming!

This is a worthy successor to the previous Rebuild App. I love the new interface, the new look, and the rival forts. These forts provide a new, and in my opinion, more realistic aspect to a theoretical zombie apocalypse: as time goes on, zombies become less of a threat and new human societies more so. However, humanity doesn't have to necessarily destroy itself again through war, as peace and trade are viable options. I love the new random events, societal policies, and survivor perks (though they can be hard to manage at times, but that comes with running a society like this). It kind of reminds me of Civilization now, but with zombies. Regardless I love it! 

The only suggestion I have is the incorporation of a map builder. It just seems like the game is asking for it, especially with its grid layout, replay ability, and set functions of each building. Players would be able to create their own towns, maybe upload them to somewhere to be accessed by all. I'd buy it if it was an in app purchase or something. Just a thought.
Overall I give 5/5, great game! Would be 6/5 with map builder to further replay ability and add a new aspect to the game.

I supported this game during its crowd funding and I am happy to have contributed! A great sequel that adds some much needed gameplay advances like rival gangs, story mode, and happiness management. A must buy!

One critique I do have is that the story mode gameplay tends to get repetitive. After you have built 7-8 cities by scavenging, fortifying, and fighting, the gameplay gets a bit tired. I don't have an exact solution, but there needs to be an increase in the variety of gameplay to fix this. 

Despite this minor flaw, I would recommend this game for anyone that likes 4x style games. Many many hours of gameplay prove this! Can't wait to see what future updates bring!

One of my favorite flash games got a sequel, amazing. I would recommend playing rebuild 2 on newgrounds to anyone who is unfamiliar with the series. I will admit that it is not for everyone, but it is definitely my cup of tea. It was encouraging to see that you can get this both on steam or mobile, and it definitely is not a cash grab. The IOS optimization is great, and seamless. The subtle storytelling is refreshing though allying with the other factions. I did find it unclear in the begging that you could have multiple talents for other characters and not just builders or just engineers, but eventually figured it out. It took me a while to figure out how to play (maybe adding an optional tutorial that can be played at anytime) but it has been a great experience. In the story, each area has a different challenge, and with the random generation, it should have great repeatability. A small thing that I would add (cause to my knowledge you can't mod iPhone games) is how the dating system worked, cause you could pick the survivor you wanted to date, and then you could determine how someone got married and they would have kids. But then the event stopped; I assume it is just one of the random ones but I would find it an interesting mechanic with survivor management. (Or maybe you can but I haven't unlocked it yet). Any way you cut it, an overall great game that accomplishes everything t set its mind to.

title.label: Great blend of strategy and adventure

content.label: This is one of few games that combine addictive strategy mechanics with an immersive story. Can hardly put it down.

I've loved the rebuild games for years and always found myself returning to them, for one reason or another. Rebuild 3 more than meets my expectations and provides a perfectly innovative, immersive and varied experience that really feels genuine to the post-apocalyptic genre.
This game is so worth every penny. But if you don't watch the tutorial you're screwed

Found out about the series with Rebuild 2, and loved it - finally beating it on the hardest level after so many tries was quite rewarding! Love that they've taken it to the next level here. Endlessly replayable since the levels are randomized. 

One suggestion for the next update or version: the other factions should be able to contact you - if you are destroying them, they should come and ask for mercy, or their scouts be able to find your fort in the beginning instead of you having to scout there's.

Thanks for the great game!

This game is really fun.😀
So yeah. A good strategy game, but if you have played the original rebuild game it is hard to adjust to the new controls. Much more detail than the original and worth $5! 😄

I am not a huge zombie game fan.  I hate IAP games and few games I play to the end.

This is one of those games that had me play to the end and it's not a short or quick game.  I this it was well worth the cost.

Loved it. Wish there were more games like it out there.  I refuse to get any IAP game.  This game was fun.
Solid gameplay. Difficulty is actually very reasonable for story mode, and there's a lot of depth to the content.

The city and it is great but the huge face on top of the buildings should be smaller or not even there....I like the older version it was neat and simple...it made me picture as if I was in a zombie atop...but this version isn't as good...the roleplaying doesn't look alright...I mean it's cool and all but not for me...

Here are something's you should add/change
-big face on top of buildings (it shouldn't be there , add the old version type just click on the building..
-make the things more simple like for example the thing on the top right isn't that cool the old version where you could open a fair size rectangle to tell people what to do and what to wear is way more simple 

Anyways the game is okey but those things I listed realy needs to be changed...

If you liked the predecessor at all, you'll want to get this game. It's a huge upgrade, and the replay factor is huge. The prior game had no challenge left once you discovered turrets, but this version is much better balanced. The story mode is cool, with, once again, multiple possible endings (though, ditching your team for your mountain cabin doesn't appear to be one of them.)

Highly recommended.

Cons: not as deep as, say, Civilization, or as flashy as some similar games based on popular zombie genre TV shows.

Pros: still plenty of fun challenges. I hope she (the dev) continues to make many more of these games.

Reviews say great And better than the first. Honestly i hate it i dnt even want to play it. Hate the setup and there is nothing better about this one. And for the cost i am just irritated i wasted my money. Please refund me.
